name: Mercury(II) iodide
desc: Mercury(II) iodide (HgI2) is a chemical compound with an appearance of red-orange crystals. Unlike mercury(II) chloride it is hardly soluble in water (<100 ppm).
Red mercury:
Mercuric iodide
Red mercury (α form only)
Solubility: slightly soluble in alcohol, ether, acetone, chloroform, ethyl acetate, CS2, olive oil, castor oil
EU classification (DSD) (outdated):
Very toxic (T+)
Dangerous for the environment (N)

Mercury(II) fluoride
Mercury(II) chloride
Mercury(II) bromide
